Quick start

  • yarn dev starts a dev server at localhost:3000
  • yarn build builds the static site into dist/static
  • yarn stories starts Ladle
  • yarn page my-new-page scaffolds a file for a new page
  • yarn component MyNewComponent scaffolds files for a new component

You can also use npm or pnpm instead of yarn.

Pages

This is your homepage. Pages live in src/pages and are either .mdx files (like this one) or plain old React components in .jsx files (like the 404 example).

Metadata

Pages can have tags, dates, and all kinds of other metadata. That lets you do stuff like render a date-ordered list of all pages with the 'post' tag:

  • My second blog post written on a Friday in July ‚Äô21
  • My first blog post written on a Thursday in April ‚Äô21

Islands & client-side JS

Tropical pages are only server rendered by default. To progressively enhance you'll need to sprinkle on some client-side JS, or opt components into hydration with Tropical Islands.

And much more!

Check out the docs or dive in and explore the src directory.
